alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 03 at 2:07AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of eastern and southeast Idaho, including the following areas, in eastern Idaho, Big Hole Mountains, Centennial Mountains - Island Park and Teton Valley. In southeast Idaho, Bear Lake Valley, Bear River Range, Blackfoot Mountains, Caribou Range, Franklin/Eastern Oneida Region, Lower Snake River Plain, Marsh and Arbon Highlands, Raft River Region, Southern Hills/Albion Mountains and Upper Snake River Plain. * WHEN...From noon MDT today through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms this afternoon and evening will be capable of producing very heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Teton Valley
